meanings.sent1: She redid her homework to correct the mistakes.
meanings.sent2: He redid the experiment to ensure accurate results.
meanings.sent3: The teacher redid the math problem to show the students the correct solution.
meanings.sent4: The artist redid the painting, adding more vibrant colors this time.
meanings.sent5: After the rain washed away the sandcastle, they redid it even better than before.

meanings.definition: To make something the same as it was before.
meanings.sent1: They redid the room to match the original design.
meanings.sent2: The tailor redid the dress to fit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The chef redid the recipe to recreate the delicious dish.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter redid the table, restoring it to its former glory.
meanings.sent5: The gardener redid the flower bed, making it look just like it did last spring.
